text: Arthur Churchill Bartholomew (21 February 1846 – 29 March 1940) was an English cricketer and schoolmaster. He was educated at Marlborough College and Trinity College, Oxford. He played a few first-class matches for Oxford University over three seasons from 1866 to 1868, with a highest score of 54 in the victory over Surrey in 1867. He was regarded as one of the best cover point fieldsmen of the day. He became an assistant master at Brighton College, and later was headmaster of preparatory schools at Great Marlow and Reading. At the time of his death he was the oldest surviving Oxbridge cricket Blue."Oxford's Oldest Cricket Blue", The Cricketer, 23 May 1936, p. 100. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1846 births Category:1940 deaths Category:English cricketers Category:Oxford University cricketers Category:People educated at Marlborough College Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Oxford Category:Schoolteachers from Devon Category:People from North Devon (district)
